title: rustc panics with index out of bounds

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Sample code in question:

``` rust
struct MyStruct {
  x: i32,
}

fn foo(v: &Vec<i32>, s: &MyStruct) {

}

fn main() {
  let v1 = vec![];
  let v2 = vec![];

  foo(&v1, &v2);
}
```

rustc correctly complains about the type of the second argument in the call to foo(), but then panics.

Backtrace:

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 16 but the index is 18', ../src/libcollections\vec.rs:1362

stack backtrace:
```
